content:
This Friday 8/28 from 2-3 PM EDT the Argonaut team will provide a brief update on the active 2020 projects:
- Bulk Data
- Granular Controls
- Patient Lists

We will also outline our goals for the upcoming Connectathon 9/9-9/11/2020.

Please join us if you can!

Join the meeting:
https://meet.jit.si/argo2020
To join by phone instead, tap this: +1.512.402.2718,,3552657320#

@Yunwei Wang and I are hosting an orientation for the Argonaut US Core Connectathon Track next week!

Tuesday 9/1 for 12-1 PM EDT
(https://mitre.zoomgov.com/j/1609808855?pwd=L0QwNEwrOUk2dkd3eG92MGgzaHFVUT09 )

In case you need to manually type meeting information:
Meeting ID: 160 980 8855
Passcode: 684922

The Cross-Group Project Work Group (CGP) is charging full steam ahead for a January 2021 ballot of US Core. 99 trackers are active and @Eric Haas and I plan to review all. Ideally, we will resolve all prior to ballot, but I am sure a few new ones will come up :)

A few priorities:

  • Must Support flagging at sub-element/references
  • Rework of Vital Signs to clarify inheritance from base FHIR core
  • Responding to US Core 'variance' requests - these are requests from other active US projects to update US Core to better support reuse of profiles.

The CGP meets Thursdays from 1-2 PM Eastern. The next call is 10/22/2020 where we plan to review Block Vote 1 which I will formally post to listserv later today. Additional calls may be scheduled. 'Someone' already jumped the gun and requested we pull a comment which is now noted with a grouping: block-vote-1-pulled.

CGP zoom information:
https://zoom.us/j/91506058769

The honorable @Floyd Eisenberg and @Jean Duteau preside over the work group
Jean is 'honorable'? :) Unfortunately I'm teaching during that timeslot on the 22nd.
np, will save for a future week. Future US Core block votes and discussions will be here: #argonaut > US Core Jan 2021 Ballot
I don't have to be there if you decide to agree with me :)
It's going to take a lot (3+ implementers) to convince me Adding a new MS element that we haven't tested
Especially an element that existed prior to R4
